intro: Hieracium thlaspifolium, commonly known as the thlaspifolium hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has serrated, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the daisy family. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
